sentence.value: Brown flew aboard Space Shuttle Columbia on STS-107, logging 15 days, 22 hours, and 20 minutes in space from January 16 to February 1, 2003.

sentence.pattern_crowdsource: Brown flew aboard [[Space Shuttle Columbia|Space_Shuttle_Columbia]] on [[STS-107|STS-107]], logging 15 days, 22 hours, and 20 minutes in [[space|SpaceShuttle]] from January 16 to February 1, 2003.

sentence.value: The flight was a dedicated science and research mission.
sentence.annotated-sentence: [[The flight|The_Flight]] was a dedicated [[science|Science]] and research mission.

sentence.value: Working 24 hours a day, in two alternating shifts, the crew successfully conducted approximately 80 experiments.
sentence.annotated-sentence: Working 24 hours a day, in two alternating shifts, the crew successfully conducted approximately 80 [[experiments|Experiment]].
sentence.pattern_crowdsource: Working 24 hours a day, in two alternating shifts, the crew successfully conducted approximately 80 experiments.

sentence.value: The mission ended abruptly on February 1, 2003, when Columbia's crew perished during entry, 16 minutes before the scheduled landing.
sentence.annotated-sentence: The mission ended abruptly on [[February|February]] 1, 2003, when Columbia's crew perished during entry, 16 [[minutes|Minute]] before the scheduled landing.
sentence.pattern_crowdsource: The mission ended abruptly on February 1, 2003, when Columbia's crew perished during entry, 16 minutes before the scheduled landing.
